For example, suppose that 4 μM of drug A and 5 μM of drug B exert the same effect as a combination of 1 μM of A and 2 μM of B. Substituting these concentrations into Eq. ( 2), we obtain CI = 0.65 (=1/4 + 2/5 < 1), implying that the drug combination is synergistic. Note that the CI does not express the extent of synergy or antagonism; it is merely a criterion that separates the two behaviors without quantifying them.
